text: Design and Control of Partial Power Processing Converter Architecture for EV Charging | MS (R) Thesis | IIT K May'24-Ongoing
bullets: Research Focus: This thesis investigates the design and simulation of a Dual Active Bridge (DAB) -based Partial Power Processing converter (PPPC) architecture for electric vehicle (EV) chargers, aiming to enhance efficiency and reduce overall system size under the supervision of Prof. Amarendra Edpuganti.

Scope: The study involves theoretical analysis and extensive simulation to optimize the PPPC architecture design, control strategies and component selection, emphasizing the practical application in fast-charging systems .

Under the direction of Prof. Md Asif Hasan, studied and simulated a SIMO DC-DC converter using a coupled inductor for high voltage gain from low input sources, employing voltage clamping (VC) and zero current switching (ZCS) techniques for improved performance.

tables: •  To develop an 18/24/30 pulse rectifiers using combinations of extended delta ,  delta polygon ,  star, and delta .

bullets: To design and simulate a single-channel gate driver for a 3-phase Neutral Point Clamped (NPC) inverter that ensures reliable and efficient switching of the power devices while maintaining proper isolation and control.

text: To understand different PWM techniques like SPWM, LSPWM, PSPWM, and 3rd harmonic injection

bullets: Basic dc-dc non-isolated converter simulations include Buck, Boost, Buck-Boost, Cuk, Sepic, and Zeta.
To simulate Forward and Flyback and interleaved 2 and 4-phase boost converters .

Design and build an affordable DC motor-based mobility scooter for disabled and local transportation, focusing on efficiency, low maintenance, and performance optimization, under the supervision of Dr. Ranjan Kumar Behera.

tables: •  Secured All India Rank 1536 in GATE 2023 EE Paper. •  Secured All India Rank 677 in GATE 2024 EE Paper . •  Secured All India Rank 275 in GATE 2024 IN Paper . •  Secured First Class with Distinction in B.E.(EEE) at BIT Mesra. •  Acquired A grade in (SEE 603) Electrical Power Engineering course subject.

•  Assisting with academic and administrative tasks related to postgraduate student records, academics, documentation, and supporting the organization of DPGC meetings. •  Coordinated departmental orientation for newly enrolled students in Winter(January) and Summer(July) 2024. •  Managed the research database, handled website data management and participated in outreach activities for the Chandrakanta Kesavan Centre for Energy Policy & Climate Solutions (CKC-EPCS) as a part of TA responsibilities.
•  TA duty for Electric Vehicle course, conducting tutorials, grading assignments, and clarifying EV technology concepts .

•  Served as the Student Guide at the Institute Counselling Services (ICS), IIT Kanpur, providing peer support and guidance on academic, career, and personal development resources. •  Facilitated the distribution and accessibility of counselling services information, including organizing workshops, advising on academic planning, and offering mental health support resources.
